		Question: who is martin luther king jr facts
		Answer:
answer: Martin Luther King Jr. was a civil rights leader in the United States. He was born in Atlanta, Georgia on January 15, 1929. He was assassinated in Memphis, Tennessee on April 4, 1968. He was a Baptist minister and a leader of the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (SCLC). He led the Montgomery bus boycott from 1955 to 1956 and organized the March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom in 1963. He was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 1964. He is considered one of the most important figures in the civil rights movement.
